All Implemented Interfaces:

Direct Known Subclasses:
bartMachine_h_eval
public abstract class bartMachine_g_mh extends bartMachine_f_gibbs_internal implements Serializable
This portion of the code performs the Metropolis-Hastings tree search step

  • Method Details

    • metroHastingsPosteriorTreeSpaceIteration

      protected bartMachineTreeNode metroHastingsPosteriorTreeSpaceIteration(bartMachineTreeNode T_i, int tree_num, boolean[][] accept_reject_mh, char[][] accept_reject_mh_steps)
      Performs one Metropolis-Hastings step for one tree
      Specified by:
      metroHastingsPosteriorTreeSpaceIteration in class bartMachine_e_gibbs_base
      Parameters:
      T_i - The original tree to be changed by a proposal step
      Returns:
      the next tree (T_{i+1}) via one iteration of M-H which can be the proposal tree (if the step was accepted) or the original tree (if the step was rejected) Debugging-only: iteration_name was used when naming the image file of this illustration

    • doMHGrowAndCalcLnR

      protected double doMHGrowAndCalcLnR(bartMachineTreeNode T_i, bartMachineTreeNode T_star)
      Perform the grow step on a tree and return the log Metropolis-Hastings ratio
      Parameters:
      T_i - The root node of the original tree
      T_star - The root node of a copy of the original tree where one node will be grown
      Returns:
      The log Metropolis-Hastings ratio See Section A.1 of Kapelner, A and Bleich, J. bartMachine: A Powerful Tool for Machine Learning in R. ArXiv e-prints, 2013

    • doMHPruneAndCalcLnR

      protected double doMHPruneAndCalcLnR(bartMachineTreeNode T_i, bartMachineTreeNode T_star)
      Perform the prune step on a tree and return the log Metropolis-Hastings ratio
      Parameters:
      T_i - The root node of the original tree
      T_star - The root node of a copy of the original tree where one set of terminal nodes will be pruned
      Returns:
      The log Metropolis-Hastings ratio See Section A.2 of Kapelner, A and Bleich, J. bartMachine: A Powerful Tool for Machine Learning in R. ArXiv e-prints, 2013

    • pickPruneNodeOrChangeNode

      protected bartMachineTreeNode pickPruneNodeOrChangeNode(bartMachineTreeNode T)
      This function picks a node suitable for pruning or changing. In our implementation this is a node that is "singly internal" (ie it has two children and its children are both terminal nodes)
      Parameters:
      T - The root of the tree we wish to find singly internal nodes
      Returns:
      A singly internal node selected at random from all candididates or null if none exist

    • calcLnTransRatioGrow

      protected double calcLnTransRatioGrow(bartMachineTreeNode T_i, bartMachineTreeNode T_star, bartMachineTreeNode node_grown_in_Tstar)
      Calculates the log transition ratio for a grow step
      Parameters:
      T_i - The root node of the original tree
      T_star - The root node of the proposal tree
      node_grown_in_Tstar - The node that was grown in the proposal tree
      Returns:
      The log of the transition ratio See Section A.1.1 of Kapelner, A and Bleich, J. bartMachine: A Powerful Tool for Machine Learning in R. ArXiv e-prints, 2013

    • calcLnLikRatioGrow

      protected double calcLnLikRatioGrow(bartMachineTreeNode grow_node)
      Calculates the log of the likelihood ratio for a grow step
      Parameters:
      grow_node - The node that was grown in the proposal tree
      Returns:
      The log of the likelihood ratio See Section A.1.2 of Kapelner, A and Bleich, J. bartMachine: A Powerful Tool for Machine Learning in R. ArXiv e-prints, 2013

    • calcLnTreeStructureRatioGrow

      protected double calcLnTreeStructureRatioGrow(bartMachineTreeNode grow_node)
      Calculates the log transition ratio for a grow step
      Parameters:
      grow_node - The node that was grown in the proposal tree
      Returns:
      The log of the transition ratio See Section A.1.3 of Kapelner, A and Bleich, J. bartMachine: A Powerful Tool for Machine Learning in R. ArXiv e-prints, 2013

    • calcLnTransRatioPrune

      protected double calcLnTransRatioPrune(bartMachineTreeNode T_i, bartMachineTreeNode T_star, bartMachineTreeNode prune_node)
      This calculates the log transition ratio for the prune step.
      Parameters:
      T_i - The root node of the original tree
      T_star - The root node of the proposal tree
      prune_node - The node that was pruned
      Returns:
      The log transition ratio See Section A.2.1 of Kapelner, A and Bleich, J. bartMachine: A Powerful Tool for Machine Learning in R. ArXiv e-prints, 2013

    • pickGrowNode

      protected bartMachineTreeNode pickGrowNode(bartMachineTreeNode T)
      Selects a node in a tree that is eligible for being grown with two children
      Parameters:
      T - The root node of the tree to be searched
      Returns:
      The node that is viable for growing

    • doMHChangeAndCalcLnR

      protected double doMHChangeAndCalcLnR(bartMachineTreeNode T_i, bartMachineTreeNode T_star)
      Perform the change step on a tree and return the log Metropolis-Hastings ratio
      Parameters:
      T_i - The root node of the original tree
      T_star - The root node of a copy of the original tree where one node will be changed
      Returns:
      The log Metropolis-Hastings ratio See Section A.3 of Kapelner, A and Bleich, J. bartMachine: A Powerful Tool for Machine Learning in R. ArXiv e-prints, 2013

    • randomlyPickAmongTheProposalSteps

      protected bartMachine_g_mh.Steps randomlyPickAmongTheProposalSteps()
      Randomly chooses among the valid tree proposal steps from a multinomial distribution
      Returns:
      The step that was chosen
